pyRVEA package¶

Submodules¶

pyRVEA.Example module¶

An example file demonstrating the use of pyRVEA.

Visit the github/binder page for further information.

pyRVEA.RVEA module¶

The python version reference vector guided evolutionary algorithm.

See the details of RVEA in the following paper

R. Cheng, Y. Jin, M. Olhofer and B. Sendhoff, A Reference Vector Guided Evolutionary Algorithm for Many-objective Optimization, IEEE Transactions on Evolutionary Computation, 2016

The source code of cRVEA is implemented by Bhupinder Saini

If you have any questions about the code, please contact:

Bhupinder Saini: bhupinder.s.saini@jyu.fi Project researcher at University of Jyväskylä.

pyRVEA.RVEA.APD_select(fitness: list, vectors: ReferenceVectors, penalty_factor: float, refV: numpy.ndarray)[source]¶

Select individuals for mating on basis of Angle penalized distance.

Parameters:
  • fitness (list) – Fitness of the current population.
  • vectors (ReferenceVectors) – Class containing reference vectors.
  • penalty_factor (float) – Multiplier of angular deviation from Reference vectors. See RVEA paper for details.
  • refV (np.ndarray) – Contains the minimum angles between reference vectors.
Returns:

A list of indices of the selected individuals.
Return type:

[type]
pyRVEA.RVEA.rvea(population: Population, problem: Problem, parameters: Parameters, reference_vectors: ReferenceVectors, progressbar: tqdm)[source]¶

Run RVEA.

This only conducts reproduction and selection. Reference vector adaptation should be done outside. Changes variable population.

Parameters:
  • population (Population) – This variable is updated as evolution takes place
  • problem (Problem) – Contains the details of the problem.
  • parameters (Parameters) – Contains the hyper-parameters of RVEA evolution.
  • reference_vectors (ReferenceVectors) – Class containing the reference vectors.
  • progressbar (tqdm or tqdm_notebook) – An iterable used to display the progress bar.
Returns:

Returns the Population after evolution.
Return type:

Population

Testing code.

Calculate hypervolume. Uses package pygmo.

keep(indices: list)[source]¶

Remove individuals from population which are not in “indices”.

mate()[source]¶

Conduct crossover and mutation over the population.

Conduct simulated binary crossover and bounded polunomial mutation. Return offspring population as an array.

non_dominated()[source]¶

Return the pareto front of a given population.

Initialize plot objects.

Plot the objective values of individuals in notebook. This is a hack.

class pyRVEA.allclasses.ReferenceVectors(lattice_resolution: int, number_of_objectives)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class object for reference vectors.

adapt(fitness)[source]¶

Adapt reference vectors.

add_edge_vectors()[source]¶

Add edge vectors to the list of reference vectors.

Used to cover the entire orthant when preference information is provided.

iteractive_adapt_1(ref_point, translation_param=0.2)[source]¶

Adapt reference vectors linearly towards a reference point.

The details can be found in the following paper: Hakanen, Jussi & Chugh, Tinkle & Sindhya, Karthik & Jin, Yaochu & Miettinen, Kaisa. (2016). Connections of Reference Vectors and Different Types of Preference Information in Interactive Multiobjective Evolutionary Algorithms.

ref_point: list. Signifies the reference point towards which the
reference vectors are translated.
translation_param: double between 0 and 1.
Describes the strength of translation.
neighbouring_angles() → numpy.ndarray[source]¶

Calculate neighbouring angles for normalization.

normalize()[source]¶

Normalize the reference vectors.

plot_ref_V()[source]¶

Plot the reference vectors.

pyRVEA.allclasses.interrupt_evolution(reference_vectors: pyRVEA.allclasses.ReferenceVectors, population: pyRVEA.allclasses.Population, problem: pyRVEA.allclasses.Problem = None, parameters: pyRVEA.allclasses.Parameters = None)[source]¶

Currently supported: Adaptaion of reference vectors with or without preference info.
